instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Slightly OT, 820-3228 2012 Mac Mini Server has power no chime
threads.message:
Customer installed second drive in this 2012 Mac Mini Server. Said a metal clip near power supply came loose and touched the board. Now it powers on, no chime no video. 

Wondering if anyone has any ideas as I cannot locate a schematic anywhere.

threads.title: Slightly OT, 820-3228 2012 Mac Mini Server has power no chime
threads.message:
No information for these available.

Check for burned or knocked off components, that is all you can do.

threads.title: Slightly OT, 820-3228 2012 Mac Mini Server has power no chime
threads.message:
Couldn't find any burned or missing/broken components. Probably shorted something somewhere. 

I knew this one was a long shot, don't know why I even took the job.

Thanks for confirming no info available.
